framework_intro.para: Below is a suggested framework to help you structure this type of letter. There are spaces for you to add your notes and the content of your letter.
Don’t forget that you can look the word up in OALD.

step.label: What is special about a formal letter?

commentary.para: The important things to remember about writing formal letters are the layout, which follows particular conventions, and the language, which must be formal or semi-formal and polite. The content of your letter should have a clear, logical structure.
Below is the framework that was used to create this letter.
Write your address, but not your name, in the top right-hand corner.
The date can go either on the left or the right under the address, or above the address on the left. It could also be January 20, 2010, (BrE) 20/1/10, or (NAmE) 1/20/10

step.label: How does the letter start and finish?

commentary.para: The writer does not know the name of the person she is writing to, so begins 'Dear Sir or Madam', and ends 'Yours faithfully'.
The writer took notes for each paragraph before beginning to write.
The writer uses key words or phrases for a formal letter.

checklist.point: Use the framework to organize notes for your own letter.
Make sure the greeting and close match.
Have I put my address (but not my name) in the right place?
Have I put the name and address of the person I'm writing to in the right place?
Have I put the date in the right place?
Does my first paragraph make it clear why I am writing?
Have I matched the greeting (Dear...) with the right ending (Yours...)?
Does my letter sound quite formal?
Have I checked vocabulary, grammar and spelling?

paragraph.name: Your address
paragraph.tip: TIP Write your address and company name, but not your own name, in the top right-hand corner.

content.prompt: Type your other contact details here

paragraph.name: Date
paragraph.tip: TIP This can go either on the left or the right under the address, or above the address on the left. It could be written November 17, 2009, 17/11/09 (BrE), or 11/17/09 (NAmE)

paragraph.name: Name/title and address of the person you are writing to.
paragraph.tip: TIP Write the name, position and address of the person you are writing to on the left-hand side. If you are writing in American style use American spelling and punctuation e.g. write Mrs. Dr., etc.

content.prompt: Type the name and address here

paragraph.name: Greeting
paragraph.tip: TIP Use 'Dear Sir or Madam' if you do not know the name of the person you are writing to. If you do know the name, use the form 'Dear Ms Klein', 'Dear Mr Smith'. If you do not know the gender you can use 'Dear Chris White', but do not use both title and first name. If you are writing in American style and you do not know the name of the person you are writing to, you can use 'To whom it may concern'.

paragraph.name: Reference
paragraph.tip: TIP An alternative for a company letter is a reference number or code, which is usually put above the address on the left.

paragraph.name: Paragraph 1
paragraph.desc: Explain clearly why you are writing.
paragraph.notes: Birmingham software company - custom-made data solutions. Hotel recommended as venue for sales conference next year.

content.para: We are a Birmingham-based software development company specializing in custom-made data solutions. Your hotel has been recommended to us as a suitable venue for our annual sales conference next year.

paragraph.name: Paragraph 2
paragraph.notes: Dates: 25 - 27 Oct. Accomm. for 25-30; all meals from dinner 25 to lunch 27. 2 conference rooms + equipment.

content.para: The dates are 25 - 27 October (inclusive) 2010 and we would require accommodation for between 25 and 30 people, including all meals from dinner on 25 October to lunch on 27th. We would also need the use of two conference rooms, with the usual facilities and equipment.

paragraph.name: Paragraph 3
paragraph.desc: State clearly what information you need.

content.para: I would be very grateful if you could let me know whether you can offer this kind of accommodation for those dates and what your rates would be.

paragraph.name: Closing
paragraph.desc: Sign your name and print it in full underneath with your job title and contact details.
paragraph.tip: TIP If you begin 'Dear + a name', end 'Yours sincerely'. Use 'Yours faithfully' here if you have begun 'Dear Sir or Madam'. In American style end your letter 'Sincerely', 'Sincerely yours', (if you use Dear + a name) or 'Yours truly'.

content.prompt: Type 'Yours sincerely', 'Yours faithfully' etc, and your name
